Megatron descended deeper into the shaft. In mere moments the magma would f=
inally fail to contain it's explosive energies. He had that precious little=
 time to find some other shaft in the tunnel to Rodimus Prime or risk being=
 ejected from the tunnel and have to find some other route. But near the bo=
iling surface of the molten rock he spotted another shaft, running perpendi=
cular to this one. He ducked into it, then trained his fusion cannon and be=
am rifle on the tunnel now below him and fired, dropping more rock and meta=
l onto the magma and melt it to at least give him ime to move freely. He th=
en turned and continued down the new shaft, scanning for Rodimus' energy si=
gnature.


--- On Mon, 10/6/08, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wr=
ote:

From: Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...>

f Hope
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
Date: Monday, October 6, 2008, 3:39 PM


=





> Scowling at the others retreatingfrm so minor an inconvieniance 
> M=
egatron looked int the hole that now was dimly illuminated by a 
> faint re=
dness. They ran. He would not be detered by a little 
> smoke and lava. Wor=
se had been done t him before, and he 
> knew his armor could withstand the=
geat tempatures. Not sparing
> te cowards a second glance or words, he jump=
ed down into thehole.
>
> Kup took his weapons and follow Megatron as well =
as Grimlock

Legacywatched Megatron jump down into the hole and then Kup an=
d Grimlock. He
just shook his head as he watched them. He suspected that th=
ey were each depending on their armor to protect them from the heat - and t=
hey would be right, typical Cybertronian armor would be strong enough towit=
hstand these tempeatures for a limited duration. 

However that was not the=
 full extent of the danger. It was the internal circuitry, the more delicat=
e metals inside that were at risk. Once the armor heated, internal temperat=
ures could rise to dangerous levels, and sensitive connections and coupling=
s could fuse or melt. Perhaps Megatron had some internal buffer to protect =
against such things, but Legacy was unaware of Grimlock or Kup having such =
modifications. 

In the distance the redness began to brighten as the tempe=
rature and pressure in the hole began to rise and liquid rock began to push=
 everything towards the surface - it would soon be erupting! 

A quick self=
-diagnostic alerted Legacy that his own shields that would normally be more=
 that capable of
withstanding such an event were still damaged from battle;=
 his self-repair circuits still working on the problem. So Legacy just watc=
hed the others from the surface, seeing little logic in risking his own exi=
stence to follow someone he did not know or trust, in an effort to recover =
someone who had either most likely had fled or had been destroyed. 

(TAG: =
Any)

Preston

He had that precious little time to find some other shaft in the tunnel to Rodimus Prime or risk being ejected from the tunnel and have to find some other route. But near the boiling surface of the molten rock he spotted another shaft, running perpendicular to this one. He ducked into it, then trained his fusion cannon and beam rifle on the tunnel now below him and fired, dropping more rock and metal onto the magma and melt it to at least give him ime to move freely.
